channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lights out on Village Road, 18th October
item.description:
Light outside 5 Newdawn Place and opposite side are off and have been for several nights. Very dark outside, not helped by uneven road surfaces.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Need to review the repair at the top of the hill, 18th October
item.description:
Previous ref - Web Reference: 7884069 | Enquiry Number: 22082475 TWO large tarmac patch, this one, and one northbound at the top of the hill, both with leading lip edges that cause a violent jolt on the car/vehicle. This one still has a leading edge to it (FYI, the northbound one has a hump of new tarmac over it, which is NOT good enough and is making things worse - and I've raised a NEW separate report on it now). I had previously asked if these edges could be made lower or smoother. Can you PLEASE grind down the tarmac and make it level to the road surface ASAP. For both of these patches, Glos Highways will be liable for car suspension damage !!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repaired patch needs repairing once again, 18th October
item.description:
Previous ref - Web Reference: 7884069 | Enquiry Number: 22082475 TWO large tarmac patch, this one, and one southbound at the top of the hill, both with leading lip edges that cause a violent jolt on the car/vehicle. This one now has even more tarmac on it creating a softer but bigger speed hump effect. I had asked if these edges could be made lower or smoother, NOT bigger and higher ! Can you PLEASE grind down the tarmac and make it level to the road surface ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown Lane, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple crashes on junction, 18th October
item.description:
No traffic management on an already busy junction, soon to be increased traffic flow due to new estate opposite. We need a yellow box or traffic lights as it is dangerous to get out with speeding cars and no give way during rush hour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldsmith Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 bus stop signs are missing along Delavale Road Winchcombe, The first one is about half w, 18th October
item.description:
Is about half the way along, next to what is now a tall fence, once a high hedge, on the left hand side and the second round a right bend, at a ditch, before the bus route turns left and down towards back lane. Without obvious bus stop signs it can be difficult to identify where and if people can catch a bus. A timetable on the stops would also be welcome, as there is a big new house estate being built along Delavale Road. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Back Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
